index.title: Welcome to Your Blank App

mriCheatsheet.title: MRI Sequences Cheatsheet
mriCheatsheet.subtitle: A quick reference guide to common MRI sequences and their key characteristics.

mobileTips.title: Mobile Operation Tips
mobileTips.description: The first column (Sequence Name) is fixed, while other columns (Characteristics, Appearance, Use) can be viewed by swiping left and right. Headers and content are perfectly aligned for clearer browsing.

mriCheatsheet.swipeHint: Swipe left and right to view more column information

t1w.name: T1-weighted (T1W)
t1w.appearance: Fat is bright, water/CSF is dark, gray matter is darker than white matter.
t1w.use: Anatomy, post-contrast imaging (gadolinium enhances bright areas).

t2w.name: T2-weighted (T2W)
t2w.appearance: Water/CSF is bright, fat is intermediate, gray matter is brighter than white matter.
t2w.use: Pathology (edema, inflammation, tumors often appear bright).

flair.name: FLAIR (Fluid-Attenuated Inversion Recovery)
flair.characteristics: Long TR, Long TE, Inversion Pulse (nulls CSF signal)
flair.appearance: Similar to T2W, but CSF is dark. Lesions near CSF are better visualized.
flair.use: Periventricular lesions (e.g., MS plaques), subarachnoid hemorrhage, edema.

dwi.name: DWI (Diffusion-Weighted Imaging)
dwi.appearance: Areas with restricted diffusion (e.g., acute stroke, high cellularity tumors) appear bright.
dwi.use: Acute stroke, abscesses, highly cellular tumors.

stir.name: STIR (Short Tau Inversion Recovery)
stir.appearance: Fat is dark, water/edema is bright.
stir.use: Fat suppression (e.g., musculoskeletal imaging for bone marrow edema, soft tissue lesions).

gre.name: GRE (Gradient Echo)
gre.characteristics: No 180-degree refocusing pulse, sensitive to susceptibility effects
gre.appearance: Blood products, calcifications, and air appear dark.
